instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message: That macbook came to me after water damage , Pulling 0.006 on DCPS and when connect to the USB AMP Meter  only was showing 5.23v so i checked <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, so i have found resistor  <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR> which a [<SIGNAL>UPC_XA_HPD_RX</SIGNAL>] and <RESISTOR>R3034</RESISTOR>,[<SIGNAL>UPC_XA_HPD_RX</SIGNAL>]   and on both sides they measure 0.00v  so  I Thought that those were shorted and i removed and replaced them , as well as <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> nd <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> now i am getting on  <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR> And <RESISTOR>R3034</RESISTOR> 0.750ohms ,  Now i am getting the 20v on my amp meter but macbook is acting very weird , as i plug usb cable with amp meter , fan would promptly start spinning then stop then restarting again , but no image on screen , Can someone explain me what [<SIGNAL>UPC_XA_HPD_RX</SIGNAL>]  for and is it normal for their  reading 0.00ohms.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

<RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34 appear both as NO STUFF in schematic.
Did you really found them on the board?
If yes, what value did you place in their position.

Their pin 2 goes to ground, normal to get short to ground, don't you think?
Both are 100K, if were placed on the board.
I don't understand how can a resistor get shorted; unless it has low value as normal (not really short then).

Try to understand a schematic, or ask for help BEFORE changing things without reason.
Your power problem was <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 related.

Does the board stay on after second restart?
Did you check for voltage on big coils?
USB activity present?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message:
Thank you very much  for your prompt reply , Indeed You do have a point  , and i did find that later that those were not supposed to be removed and replaced , but i was very confused since the reading on the amp meter was giving 5.23v was thinking maybe those resistors were probably the one causing the issue , but apparantly Yes <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 was my problem .

The board seems to stay on , cause i made a test with the battery connected and when i plug the usb cable i can hear the sound that  the power cable is connected but no image , no backlight on either screen nor keyboard.

when i test the big coils i am getting 0.00V

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message: USB activities , sometimes it would just turn off on the amp meter and then turn back on with 20V showing on amp meter but zero consumption

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message:
I talk about REAL USB activity, not power.
Get an USB pendrive with preinstalled macOS and Link LED; if flashes, there is 100% activity.

0V on all big coils???
Then no reason to search for image, nor USB activity.
But if fan spins, 5V is there at least.
And you heard even power sound!
I bet you have voltage on more coils...

threads.message: I Don't have a pendrive handy , I will Recheck all the coils again , now my how do i get  <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/3034 To their original state since i am getting 0.765 ohms since they were supposed to be 0.00 ohm that was what I was getting initially when i  started diagnosing the macbook. Also do you have some specific coils do  i have to check or I have to check all of them?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message:
As I mentioned before, <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34 have 100K both; check schematic, please!!!
You've get 0 ohms before because of bad <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200.

How do you get power sound when connect charger, if no voltage on coils?
Nothing on L7600?
What about <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> at least?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message:
Hi , L7600 I was getting also 0V,  I did not check <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>  , I will check that  too and get back to you  . In Regards of <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34  , I did not have a donor board to measure their resistance to compare , but funny thing about it , I changed <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 First  then check Resistance of <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34 And was still 0V that was how i got confused , but with  that,  i was getting fan spinning then stopped but like i mentioned if battery is connected when connecting USB cable and connect it back that was when i was getting sound , But no display , no back light  on keyboard or screen , that was when i changed <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34 and since then i am getting fan spin but very prompt and stop then restart again  but this time with battery connected if i connect the cable , i am not getting the sound anymore. do you have any chance have a good working board if you would please give me the resistance value of R/3033/34 I know one side goes to ground but the positive sides.

Please

threads.message: I already said you two times; these are 100 Kohms resistors, exactly as in schematic.

Hello 

You were helping me last week with this macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  , I was able to figure out the issues and it got it fixed , but now there s a funny thing that i am getting and i am not able to figure it out , before i point anything out  I decided to first reach out to you for help.

Now all power rails are responding ok , but i am getting this weird backlight issue  which is very funny to me , when powering the device ,it turns on normal but then as soon as the keyboard lights up the lcd promptly shows apple logo booting for about 2 seconds then goes black , then promptly flashes back again then backlight goes off again , i cleaned the LCD fpc connector , it turned on normal so as soon as i disconnect the lcd connector and reconnect it i am getting the same , but keyboard backlight is working perfectly fine , now the other thing that i found funnier is if i disconnect the battery and connect the USB charger keyboard backlight  does not turn on,  but LCD showing normal backlight with battery  sign only . So  I am assuming that my backlight driver IC is working  , so can this issue relate to the battery or the flex that connect the lcd to the motherboard , i do not have  another flex cable  here to make a test. Please advice

Thank you.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage

Test that, against classic flexgate issue.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message: I was made a discover i found a missing transistor which happens to be <SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>  and a small capacitor missing  at  J5250, would that be art of my issue?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Dead after water damage
threads.message: Probably, as the Hall sensor is related with sleep function.

Thank you.
